attributes.action: We the people want power to control our MP's
attributes.additional_details: Voters are powerless if an MP fails to represent them. We propose allowing constituents to start a recall petition if they get signatures from at least 10% of registered voters. If this threshold is met, a by-election would follow. To prevent misuse, there would be a limit of one recall per MP per year and no recalls in the first four months of a term. This would give voters more say and ensure MPs are accountable to their constituents. We urge the Government to create this new recall system.
attributes.background:
Empower constituents to recall MPs through a stronger, voter-driven process. 

This is where an existing MP can be dismissed.

We call on the Government to strengthen the Recall of MPs Act 2015 by introducing a constituent-driven recall mechanism that gives real power back to voters.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

You may wish to sign this petition: 

Make MP recall rules stricter
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/707488
